1.brief: stillness; adverbially, silently; abstractly quiet, trust

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
a promise (to God); also (concretely) a thing promised

2.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

3.brief: a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to be strong; by implication, to prevail, act insolently
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to cover (specifically with bitumen); figuratively, to expiate or condone, to placate or cancel

4.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls)
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
good (as a noun), in the widest sense, especially goodness (superlative concretely, the best), beauty, gladness, welfare
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
a large public building, such as a palace or temple

5.brief: to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, a refuge, i.e. (objective) security, or (subjective) assurance
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)

6.brief: properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory

7.brief: properly, to address in aloud tone, i.e. (specifically) loud; figuratively, to pacify (as if by words)
uproar (as of rushing); by implication, destruction

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
uproar (as of rushing); by implication, destruction
something rolled, i.e. a heap of stone or dung (plural ruins), by analogy, a spring of water (plural waves)
a noise, tumult, crowd; also disquietude, wealth

8.brief: to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a signal (literally or figuratively), as aflag, beacon, monument, omen, prodigy, evidence, etc.

a going forth, i.e. (the act) an egress, or (the place) an exit; hence, a source or product; specifically, dawn, the rising of the sun (the East), exportation, utterance, a gate, a fountain, a mine, a meadow (as producing grass)
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)

9.brief: to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to run after or over, i.e. overflow
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
properly, to accumulate; chiefly (specifically) to grow (causatively, make) rich
a rill (i.e. small channel of water, as in irrigation)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)

10.brief: to slake the thirst (occasionally of other appetites)
to sink, i.e. descend; causatively, to press or lead down
a rain (as an accumulation of drops)
to melt, i.e. literally (to soften, flow down, disappear), or figuratively (to fear, faint)
a sprout (usually concrete), literal or figurative
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)

11.brief: to encircle (for attack or protection); especially to crown (literally or figuratively)
a year (as a revolution of time)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular)
the fat; abstractly fatness, i.e. (figuratively) abundance; specifically the (fatty) ashes of sacrifices

12.brief: a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
a revolution (of time, i.e. an age); also joy
to gird on (as a belt, armor, etc.)

13.brief: properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
a ram (as full-grown and fat), including a battering-ram (as butting); hence, a meadow (as for sheep); also a pad or camel's saddle (as puffed out)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
to shroud, i.e. clothe (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of darkness) to languish
grain of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension the open country
to mar (especially by breaking); figuratively, to split the ears (with sound), i.e. shout (for alarm or joy)
meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though

14.brief: properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
a ram (as full-grown and fat), including a battering-ram (as butting); hence, a meadow (as for sheep); also a pad or camel's saddle (as puffed out)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
to shroud, i.e. clothe (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of darkness) to languish
grain of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension the open country
to mar (especially by breaking); figuratively, to split the ears (with sound), i.e. shout (for alarm or joy)
meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
